articles.title: BBVA and OpenAI collaborate to transform global banking
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with OpenAI to revolutionize global banking by integrating AI technology into its operations, aiming to enhance customer experience and improve efficiency. This collaboration is expected to drive innovation in areas such as chatbots, fraud detection, and personalized financial services. By leveraging OpenAI's cutting-edge technology, BBVA seeks to stay ahead of the curve in the rapidly evolving banking landscape.

articles.title: BNY builds “AI for everyone, everywhere” with OpenAI
articles.summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with OpenAI to develop an "AI for everyone, everywhere" platform, aiming to make artificial intelligence more accessible and widespread. This collaboration is expected to drive innovation and improve customer experiences across various industries. By democratizing AI, BNY Mellon and OpenAI seek to unlock new possibilities and opportunities for individuals and businesses alike.

articles.title: How We Used Codex to Ship Sora for Android in 28 Days
articles.summary: The team behind Sora leveraged Codex, an AI-powered coding tool, to develop and ship the Android version of their app in just 28 days. Codex's automated coding capabilities significantly accelerated the development process, allowing the team to meet their tight deadline. This achievement showcases the potential of AI-assisted coding in rapidly bringing new apps to market.

articles.title: Advancing science and math with GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a cutting-edge AI model that promises to revolutionize science and math education by providing personalized learning experiences and solving complex problems. This innovative technology has the potential to make STEM subjects more accessible and engaging for students of all levels. With GPT-5.2, the possibilities for advancing scientific discovery and mathematical understanding have never been more exciting.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a significant upgrade to the GPT series, boasting improved language understanding and generation capabilities. This new model is expected to enhance various AI applications, including chatbots, language translation, and content creation. With GPT-5.2, users can anticipate more accurate and human-like interactions with AI systems.

articles.title: Improved Gemini audio models for powerful voice experiences
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its Gemini audio models, enabling more accurate and efficient voice experiences. The improved models can better understand and respond to user voice commands, paving the way for more powerful and intuitive voice assistants. This innovation is expected to enhance the overall voice interaction experience across various devices and applications.

articles.title: Deepening our partnership with the UK AI Security Institute
articles.summary: A leading tech company has announced a partnership with the UK AI Security Institute to advance AI security research and development. This collaboration aims to drive innovation in AI-powered security solutions, enhancing protection against emerging threats. The partnership is expected to yield cutting-edge technologies and expertise, shaping the future of AI security in the UK and beyond.

articles.title: Strengthening our partnership with the UK government to support prosperity and security in the AI era
articles.summary: A leading tech company has announced a strengthened partnership with the UK government to drive AI innovation and support national prosperity and security. This collaboration aims to harness AI's potential to boost economic growth, improve public services, and enhance cybersecurity. By working together, the company and the UK government seek to establish the country as a global leader in responsible AI development and deployment.

articles.title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive evaluation tool designed to assess the factuality of large language models. This suite systematically tests a model's ability to provide accurate and truthful information, helping to identify areas for improvement. By using FACTS, developers can refine their models to reduce misinformation and increase the reliability of AI-generated content.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to combat the challenges of a warming climate, using innovative techniques such as gene editing and precision breeding. These advancements aim to improve crop yields, enhance drought tolerance, and increase resistance to extreme weather conditions. By engineering climate-resilient crops, researchers hope to ensure global food security and mitigate the impacts of climate change on agriculture.

articles.title: New in llama.cpp: Model Management
articles.summary: The latest update to llama.cpp introduces model management capabilities, allowing users to easily manage and switch between different AI models. This innovation enables more flexibility and customization in AI applications, making it simpler to adapt to various use cases and workflows. By streamlining model management, llama.cpp enhances the overall user experience and expands its potential applications.

articles.title: Codex is Open Sourcing AI models
articles.summary: Codex is open-sourcing its AI models, making it easier for developers to access and build upon the technology. This move is expected to accelerate innovation in the field of artificial intelligence and drive new applications. By making its models publicly available, Codex is democratizing access to AI and enabling a wider range of users to harness its potential.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cost-efficient AI model that achieves frontier multimodal performance, enabling efficient processing of various data types such as text, images, and audio. This innovation has the potential to improve applications like chatbots, virtual assistants, and content generation. By reducing computational costs, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker makes multimodal AI more accessible and affordable for widespread adoption.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The Hugging Face team has introduced swift-huggingface, a comprehensive Swift client that enables seamless integration with their popular AI model hub. This new client allows developers to easily access and utilize Hugging Face's vast library of models, including transformers and other AI architectures, directly within their Swift applications. By bridging the gap between Swift and Hugging Face, developers can now build more intelligent and AI-powered iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced DeepMath, a groundbreaking math reasoning agent that utilizes smolagents to provide lightweight and efficient mathematical problem-solving capabilities. This innovative approach enables DeepMath to tackle complex math problems with increased accuracy and speed. By leveraging smolagents, DeepMath has the potential to revolutionize math education and research with its enhanced reasoning and problem-solving abilities.

articles.title: OpenAI are quietly adopting skills, now available in ChatGPT and Codex CLI
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced a new feature called "skills" in ChatGPT and Codex CLI, allowing users to access specialized capabilities and tools within the platforms. This update enables more precise and efficient interactions, enhancing the overall user experience. With skills, users can tap into a range of specific functions, from coding and data analysis to content creation and more.

articles.title: macOS 26.2 enables fast AI clusters with RDMA over Thunderbolt
articles.summary: macOS 26.2 introduces a significant update, enabling fast AI clusters with RDMA (Remote Direct Memory Access) over Thunderbolt, allowing for high-speed data transfer and accelerated AI processing. This innovation enables developers to create powerful AI clusters using Macs connected via Thunderbolt, streamlining AI development and deployment. By leveraging Thunderbolt's high bandwidth, macOS 26.2 unlocks new possibilities for AI research and development.

articles.title: Google Removes Sci-Hub Domains from U.S. Search Results Due to Dated Court Order
articles.summary: Google has removed Sci-Hub domains from US search results, complying with a 2017 court order that aimed to curb access to the pirate academic database. This move restricts access to scientific papers and research articles for users in the US, potentially hindering research and educational efforts. The removal highlights the ongoing tension between copyright holders and advocates for open access to scientific knowledge.
